intro: Penducella monilia, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a unique plant belonging to the family Gesneriaceae. It is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that are often pale or translucent, giving it its ethereal appearance. Its ornamental value has made it a popular choice among collectors and horticulturists.
